comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Looks like an Ayrshire... The digitised newspapers mention a T.W. Lindsay, of Kembla Park, Unanderra, who was a member of the Ayrshire Herdbok Society, a show judge, etc...possibly this chap. I gather he and his brother and other Lindsay ?cousins were prominent NSW Ayrshire breeders in the 1920s and 1930s... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article117346730 nla.gov.au/nla.news-article116276642 Provided the Land had their pic the right way around, she's not 'Horsley Laura'. nla.gov.au/nla.news-article104226572 Ditto 'Horsley Tinsel' acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=7705 not this one either...different number... nla.gov.au/nla.news-page5708109 a not too good 1907 T&CJ pic of T. Lindsay...looks similar to the chap in this Hall pic.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thanks Quasymody, you've prompted me to look at this from another angle. The Sands Directory (via Ancestry.com) has entries for a T.W. Lindsay in Unanderra from 1925 into the 1930s. There is also a 'E.A. Lindsay' and 'J.C.' and 'J.R. Lindsay' listed in the same area. Particularly intrigued by the image in the last article - if only it was a little lighter! Profile seems very much the same... This lovely article goes into detail about the history of the Lindsay family, including Thomas William Lindsay (1864-1941). Would seem to match the age of the gentleman in this pic.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
